meanings.definition: The excessive adherence to official rules and procedures.
meanings.sent1: Her officialism caused delays in the project as she insisted on following every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The company's officialism sometimes hinders innovation as employees feel restricted by strict procedures.
meanings.sent3: Despite his officialism, he couldn't resist sneaking in a small personal touch to the otherwise rigid report.
meanings.sent4: The officialism of the bureaucracy was like a thick fog, obscuring any flexibility or creativity.
meanings.sent5: The officialism of the school's dress code made it feel like students were living in a world of black and white.

meanings.definition: The belief in or reliance on official authority or status.
meanings.sent1: His blind officialism led him to always trust those in positions of power without question.
meanings.sent2: In times of uncertainty, people often turn to officialism for a sense of security and stability.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cat's officialism was evident when it would only listen to commands if she wore a suit.
meanings.sent4: The officialism of the celebrity made fans treat every word they said as gospel.
meanings.sent5: The officialism of the politician's speeches made it seem like they were the ultimate authority on all matters.
